dilute.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid
dilute.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Dilute the paint with a little oil.
dilute.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make a quality, belief etc weaker or less effective
dilute.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: an attempt to dilute the proposals
dilute.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
dilute.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if a company dilutes its shares or the earnings on its shares, it increases the number of its shares that are available and so reduces the amount that each share will earn
dilute.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: They issued new shares which diluted the equity of the current shareholders.
$900 million equity infusion could dilute earnings by 10% next year.
